posts.title: Pentagon warned staffers against using Signal before White House chat leak
top_comments:
>But according to a Pentagon “OPSEC special bulletin” seen by NPR reporters and sent on 18 March, Russian hacking groups may exploit the vulnerability in Signal to spy on encrypted organizations, potentially targeting “persons of interest”.

I guess Pete Hegseth didn’t get the memo.

There is no justification for using Signal for official communications other than evading record collection laws, something Republicans used to consider literally the most important thing in the world.
So why is no one chanting "lock him up".

And again it’s worth noting not a single person in that chat said anything like “why are we discussing this here? Is this normal? This seems weird to me”

No, they all went with it. This tells me that this scenario isn’t unusual for them. They do this shit all the time, which is HIGHLY DISTURBING (and illegal) and should concern EVERYONE.
Staffers used it in his first administration, in violation of the records law, and no one was prosecuted.

As an IT Systems Engineer, it seems unfathomable that their devices are not managed and hardened by a Mobile Device Management platform. All my company phones are managed and users cannot install apps which are not approved.
Where. Are. The. Consequences.

The people Trump has appointed are sycophants and not versed in statecraft.

They completely lack governance experience. 

Remember this when you or ones you love are impacted. Remember this when it's time to vote them out and hold them accountable.
Well of course they did. And of course they did it anyway. And of course, every conservative alive is bending over backwards to convince themselves this is a nothing burger of a story.
There is no reason that the US Government doesn't maintain it's own communication network.

posts.title: As top Trump aides sent texts on Signal, flight data show a member of the group chat was in Russia
top_comments: Every single action the trump admin takes is beneficial to Russia, they are acting no differently than how an agent for the Russian government would be acting in this position.

> Witkoff arrived in Moscow shortly after noon local time on March 13, according to data from the flight tracking website FlightRadar24, and Russian state media broadcast video of his motorcade leaving Vnukovo International Airport shortly after.

> During the group discussion on Signal, Goldberg reported, **Ratcliffe named an active CIA intelligence officer** in the chat at 5:24 p.m. eastern time, which was just after midnight in Russia. Witkoff’s flight did not leave Moscow until around 2 a.m. local time, and Sergei Markov, a former Putin advisor who is still close to the Russian president, said in a Telegram post that **Witkoff and Putin were meeting in the Kremlin until 1:30 a.m.**


Seriously, what more is needed to charge these guys with whatever your equivalent of treason is?

At this point, I’m pretty sure the ‘VP’ in the chat was not the couch molester, it was Vladimir Putin (only half /s).
This is like Watergate level, it's gotten people jailed and killed Hillary's entire political career for 1/10th of what happened.

Why was a government official in Russia, meeting with Putin until 1:30 AM local time? Forget the entire Signal issue (for a moment, then don't forget it please) and try to answer that question without suggesting that this administration is completely in the pocket of Russia? You cannot do it. 

Somewhere, somehow, there has to be a truly patriotic Republican in Congress that will say something. Right?

Approx. a decade ago, a presidential candidacy imploded using a coordinated, performative, non-stop attack by right wing news outlets on Hillary’s emails; packaged and distributed so successfully by the Trump republicans that they still refer to it, literally, today. Left to center/apolitical outlets dropped the ball.

Democrats: You couldn’t ask for a more perfect opportunity. Hell, the playbook has already been written.

Your move. America (and the rest of the world) is watching.
Republican voters decided en mass that they were pro Russia. Here we are.
Wonderful.  I wonder how much more fucked up this story will get….

This just keeps getting better and better. I know Hanlon's Razor almost certainly applies here, but this is all so perfectly damaging to the administration that I can't help but wonder is some low-ranking aid didn't send that text to the journalist as a form of whistle blowing.
Whatever soil Tulsi Gabbard is standing on is technically Russian soil, so there were two.
Krasnov gonna Krasnov

posts.title: After living in the US for 35 years and raising 3 citizens, these parents got deported to Colombia. Their kids want them back
top_comments:
From the article: 

“Gladys and Nelson came to the United States without authorization in 1989, according to an Immigration and Customs Enforcement statement dated March 14. They had no visas when they arrived, Crooms said, but were granted permission to apply for asylum. The couple was fleeing crime in their native Colombia, according to Crooms and their daughter Stephanie.

In 2000, the immigration court found no legal reason that would allow Gladys and Nelson to stay in the United States and they were issued a voluntary departure order, which gives people a certain amount of time to leave the country at their own expense to avoid a deportation order, according to ICE.“

They applied for asylum, denied and ordered to come back to Columbia. 

When people applied for asylum they issued temporary SS number and work permit. 
How did they legally worked in US for 30 years without valid SS number?
As shitty as it is, this isn’t a current administration caused problem. They were told 25 years ago they had to leave.

to be clear, they agreed to be deported, but stayed.

they did follow the agreement they made with the USCIS for check ins (for like 20 yrs of doing that), but they always knew this could happen.

unfortunately, their number got called.

hopefully the kids will sponsor them and they can return in 10 yrs.

i wonder how many other immigrant families had this happen to them, it’s just the media picked this aesthetic family who can speak perfectly fluent english to compound the story….living in gorgeous and expensive newport beach, no less.

just saying.
They lost their hearings and were ordered to leave and failed to do so…this one isn’t the hill to die on

*"In 2000, the immigration court found no legal reason that would allow Gladys and Nelson to stay in the United States and they were issued a voluntary departure order, which gives people a certain amount of time to leave the country at their own expense to avoid a deportation order, according to ICE*

*...*

*The Gonzalezes did not plan to leave the United States after the order was issued, according to Crooms, who said the couple’s attorney at the time misled them that the order could be appealed and possibly lead to eventual legalization.*

*...*

*The couple’s deportation officer “had not pushed for them to depart until 2018,” leveling with them that it was time to leave the country if their status couldn’t be legalized, Crooms said."*

Seems pretty reasonable to me they needed to be deported, they've been told so since 2000, and again in 2018. Just not in handcuffs.

So, they overstayed by 25 years?

>**In 2000, the immigration court found no legal reason that would allow Gladys and Nelson to stay in the United States and they were issued a voluntary departure order**, which gives people a certain amount of time to leave the country at their own expense to avoid a deportation order, according to ICE.
Damn, I would be devastated if something like that happens to my parents. I hope the best for them.

Entered illegally, informed to leave, didn't do it.

What should happen?

“Gladys and Nelson came to the United States without authorization in 1989

In 2000, the immigration court found no legal reason that would allow Gladys and Nelson to stay in the United States and they were issued a voluntary departure order, which gives people a certain amount of time to leave the country at their own expense to avoid a deportation order.”

So they entered illegally 36 years ago. Where ordered to leave 25 years ago and chose not to. I would say the US government was more then fair and consideret before deportation. They thought they were above the law. Their children can blame them not the US government.
The news would be that the government allowed them to be illegal 35 years. Not that they were finally deported.

posts.title: Texas measles outbreak grows to 327 cases with 18 confirmed infections over last 5 days: Officials
top_comments: There were 13 in 2020. Nationally.

If they aren’t getting Measles vaccinations, they probably aren’t getting Rubella vaccinations, as part of the typical measles, mumps, rubella one dose.  If Rubella spreads it will be another generation of children with severe learning disabilities.

This update adds 18 new cases to the number of reported cases in Texas associated with the outbreak. Last Friday's update added 30 cases. Last Tuesday’s update added 20 new cases. The previous Friday's update added 36 cases.

No new hospitalizations or deaths were reported for Texas.

Got my measles status checked last week. No immunity despite 3 shots in 1971 and 1 more in 1974. (Germany)

Got vaccinated again yesterday.

People over 50, go and get your measles titer checked NOW!

Did some rough math based on the article.

~~.0061162079510703%~~ 0.6% of cases are with people who are vaccinated.

>The CDC currently recommends that people receive two vaccine doses, the first at ages 12 to 15 months and the second between 4 and 6 years old. One dose is 93% effective, and two doses are 97% effective, the CDC says. Most vaccinated adults don't need a booster.

This is easy folks.

I’m to the point of just accepting that people will be benefiting from the consequences of their actions. 

I got nothing else inside of me anymore.

New Mexico added 1 new case today to their total reported case count (up to 43 from 42) for this outbreak.

Oklahoma added 5 new cases today to their total (up to 9 from 4) for this outbreak.

Due to idiot adults here come incoming cases of: 

Chickenpox (varicella) vaccine

COVID-19 vaccine

Dengue vaccine

Diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis (DTaP, Tdap) vaccine

Hepatitis A (HepA) vaccine

Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine

Hepatitis B (HepB) vaccine

Human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine

Influenza (flu) vaccine

Measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) vaccine

Meningococcal (MenACWY, MenB) vaccines

Pneumococcal (PCV13, PPSV23) vaccines

Polio (IPV) vaccine

Rotavirus (RV) vaccine
they will somehow feel more vindicated and devoted to their cause AND they will blame liberals and find a way to punish them for allowing this to happen.

Just listen to your red politicians tell you, and the orange one. they know more than doctors or scientists! bleach and vitamin C 

They would never betray you *snicker snicker*

posts.title: USDA halts delivery of 600,000 pounds of food to Michigan food bank
top_comments: After all this there's going to be billions in bailouts paid to farmers affected by these decisions. They're going to end up paying to let the food rot.

The wilful cruelty of the Trump regime astonishes me. Here in the U.K. we have had right wing governments but this is new territory. Also our worst Trump like Prime Minister only lasted 49 days before being ousted. Mind you she cost us our economy and she killed the queen so there is that.

Can somebody explain to me the idea behind this?  Are they trying to disband food banks?  Is it that they want absolutely zero government aid to the general population because of anti-government ideology?  I don't understand their thinking.
Even the Roman emperors knew that you had to give people bread & circuses. Does Trump think starving people will just roll over and die? Because boy is he going to be surprised.
News says have empathy for poor Elon not the actual poor
This is a heartbreaking reminder of how fragile our food security system can be. Policies should prioritize people over logistics
Keeping poor people alive that don’t contribute to society is wasteful spending /s

I volunteer a couple times a week at a local food bank, not in Michigan. This is a goddamn shame. People don't realize that while the community donations definitely help, a lot of the food comes out of government programs or grants. When you cut that stuff you very directly hurt the people who need help eating.
Ah yes, the old "fuck you citizens"
All of Michigan's electoral votes went to Trump. He doesn't even take care of the states that supported him.

posts.title: US consumer confidence tumbles for the 4th straight month as future expectations hit a 12-year low
top_comments: Tariff don't need more time to prove they are not working
Everything that’s been occurring points to this establishment just trying to defund and destabilize America. We are being attacked from within and breaking ties with all alliances.
I've stopped buying anything non-essential because I have no idea how much this shit is gonna cost 6 months from now.
This is the Trump effect just not the one he wants you to think about.
It’s what Trump voters wanted.
I don’t have a whole lot of confidence that my American dollars will be worth much after this admin intentionally crashes the economy. So this tracks.
Incompetence leads to no confidence.
Every one with a brain has been preparing for a recession the moment Trump won 2024.

The world market is set up in a way where its almost impossible for the US to fail.   
  
Trump is doing sooooo poorly that he’s miraculously accomplishing that feat. Impressive
If only this could have been prevented in November....

posts.title: Gunman who killed 23 in racist attack at Texas Walmart offered plea deal to avoid death penalty.
top_comments:
Shit, how bad is it that I mistook him for the OTHER racist shooter in Buffalo in 2021? Anyway, here’s the key part of the article:

“”The vast majority of them want this case over and done with as quickly as possible,” he said.

Montoya also said pursuing the death penalty would mean a long and drawn-out legal battle with many hearings and appeals.”
I can see how the families would prefer this just to be over with. It's not like the guy is ever getting out.
I wonder what he thinks about his face being a meme.
For a crime like this he will end up in a supermax. In about 6 months he will have wished he picked the other option.
Does this guy really want to spend the rest of his life in prison?
At least he didn’t vandalize a Tesla
waste of a plea deal tbh

It’s scary to me that i don’t even remember this and he killed 23 souls. We are so desensitized now. I was 10 when columbine happened and I remember thinking a mass shooting was unfathomable. I can still see the headline in my local paper: “WHY?” with a woman holding the sides of her face in anguish.

Almost 30 years later and we’re still asking the same question.
How about another option where each of the victims family members gets to punch him in his ugly ass face
It’s actually cheaper to imprison him for life than wasting tax payers and the judicial system.

posts.title: Japan court orders controversial ‘Moonies’ church to disband
top_comments: Americans might not be aware, but the Unification Church has leveraged its Japanese influence to control something like 80% of the sushi market in the US via a company called True World Foods.
That assassin flat out achieved his objectives. Crazy.

The order handed down by a Tokyo district court will strip the church of its tax-exempt status and require it to liquidate its assets, but it will still be allowed to operate in Japan.

So it's not really disbanded.

God, I haven't heard about  the moonies for decades.

I thought they already disbanded.
fucking do it. tired of these ponzi schemes disguised as churches skirting the law because "we don't want to be religiously intolerant"

Not so fun fact: The majority of the Unification Church's global revenue came from Japan and they diverted lots of funds to North Korea, which may or may not have went to North Korea's nuclear development and development of intercontinental ballistic missiles.
A friend grew up in that cult.  The stories are fucking made of nightmares.

JD Vance recently spoke at Moonies summit and called for "religious freedom".

https://familyfedcommunity.org.uk/vice-president-jd-vance-champions-religious-freedom-and-calls-for-global-faith-unity-at-irf-summit/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n_tLseIm2Po

For those, like me, who didn't follow the investigation:
>Investigations following Abe's assassination revealed close ties between the secretive sect and many conservative ruling-party lawmakers, leading to the resignation of four ministers.
An internal investigation by former prime minister Fumio Kishida's Liberal Democratic Party found that 179 of its 379 lawmakers had interacted with the Unification Church.
The relationships ranged from attending church events to accepting donations and receiving election support.
The revelations about the extent and level of involvement of the controversial church and the LDP shocked the nation.
No more Shooreh Pippi…

posts.title: United Airlines flight to China diverted to San Francisco after pilot forgets passport
top_comments: Imagine the pilot saying 'We'll be turning back… my bad, y'all.'

How was he even allowed to board in the first place? Don’t they check passport at departure?

I know there are crew lanes; I meant don’t they check at crew lanes?
I have (sad and hilarious) nightmares about doing this.

If the pilot just stayed on the plane when they landed, would it even matter? I suppose it's probably pretty unlikely that the pilot would be taking the same plane back, but in the event that they were, would they HAVE to even get off the plane once it landed and go through customs?

Article does NOT mention whether the pilot or airline were immediately transparent with their 100-300 customers who were just massively inconvenienced. 


Humans make human errors. Fine. I'm a lot more forgiving if they own up to them and apologize up front.

~~If the destination were in EU, that's 600 euros per ticket.~~

EDIT: United is not an EU registered airline so you are fucked either way. Sorry for the misinformation.

Would've been funny if they'd just had the pilot not deboard in China, and come back with nobody the wiser. I'm sure that would've required a new flight crew for the be trip, but it still would've been sneaky.
Did I turn the stove off? Better turn back and go check. “Sorry folks”.
So how long were those people on the last plane
Do passengers get their money back as well as compensation for their lost time/trip?

posts.title: 23andMe bankruptcy filing sparks privacy fears as DNA data of millions goes up for sale
top_comments:
To all the comments talking about how privacy means you never used one of these things, you're wrong. If your parents, siblings, cousins, uncles, kids, or even grandma's sister twice removed use these things they learn about you too. With enough points of  data you can basically pinpoint anybody and guess with reasonable certainty their genetic inheritance. 

Insurance companies buying up databases like this to target individuals with higher premiums for certain care (like Ashkenazi Jews and breast cancer) are the problem. We need laws to prevent any use of different or preferential treatment based on genetic markings of any kind.
I hate to break it to you but it was for sale before they went bankrupt, that’s how they made money. Evidently not enough money though
How much you want to bet someone in the health insurance business will buy this data? I'm betting they are willing to spend a lot more than anyone not in the business.

I have 3 family members use this site. When my mother did it...it already showed she had 3 kids but we were unidentified in her tree. The other two members her brother and her brothers daughter also were mapped out.

And she found out when grandpa went to war and left from Texas she has a half brother there who has a son my age 40 and used that site and found them.

My concern is if something like this is acwuired by a hostile or venture capitalist funded healthcare system or insurance agency that it would be used to increase denials and feed bad AI like the UHC AI Claim Denial of 90%+ and be used for genetic trace marking to look for, or assume, genetic predisposition for Hereditary or Genetic illnesses and use that as a basis to increase rate of denials based on knowledge a patirnt may not even be aware of.

It becomes a network of intelligence that any nation or ctiminal organization would climax over.
if only there were warnings about giving your DNA to an opensource. But hey, not knowing that you're .4 % Levantine would drive anyone insane.
They already lost data to hack. Of course they are gonna sell it too.

Insurance companies are salivating at this opportunity. Pre-existing condition? No, even better - genetically predisposed condition is where the gravy is, baby. Already-manifesting conditions is so early 2020s.
Those of us afraid for privacy have avoided these sites like the plague.  Being afraid for privacy after you've already given out all your info isn't ideal.
I'll buy it, my offer is 20 bucks. I'll look through it, nod sagely while pretending to understand, and delete it.

posts.title: Reports: Man and 2 children found alive on frozen Alaska lake 12 hours after their plane was reported overdue
top_comments:
>The rescue was touted as “remarkable and good news” by National Transportation Safety Board Western Pacific Region Chief Dennis Hogenson, KTUU reported.

With the recent spate of crashes and general airplane shenaniganery, it's also really nice to see people able to walk away from most of these incidents.
It's nice to see a happy ending
Surviving a plane crash in Alaska for 12 hours? That’s some real-life survivor stuff right there. Glad they’re safe, but man, that’s a close call.
Don’t let it be the outdoor boys!

It's amazing how many small plane accidents (and accompanying deaths) there are, and yet almost no major Airline accidents in the U.S. since the 1970s. The former have been really on the rise since 2018, and yet apart from the DC and 2003 crash, almost none in the latter.
Unfortunately, there was supposed to be a dad, mom, and 3 kids. Sacrifices had to be made.

posts.title: Pentagon warned staffers against using Signal before White House chat leak

>But according to a Pentagon “OPSEC special bulletin” seen by NPR reporters and sent on 18 March, Russian hacking groups may exploit the vulnerability in Signal to spy on encrypted organizations, potentially targeting “persons of interest”.

There is no justification for using Signal for official communications other than evading record collection laws, something Republicans used to consider literally the most important thing in the world.
So why is no one chanting "lock him up".

And again it’s worth noting not a single person in that chat said anything like “why are we discussing this here? Is this normal? This seems weird to me”

No, they all went with it. This tells me that this scenario isn’t unusual for them. They do this shit all the time, which is HIGHLY DISTURBING (and illegal) and should concern EVERYONE.
Staffers used it in his first administration, in violation of the records law, and no one was prosecuted.

As an IT Systems Engineer, it seems unfathomable that their devices are not managed and hardened by a Mobile Device Management platform. All my company phones are managed and users cannot install apps which are not approved.
Where. Are. The. Consequences.

They completely lack governance experience. 

Remember this when you or ones you love are impacted. Remember this when it's time to vote them out and hold them accountable.

posts.title: 23andMe bankruptcy filing sparks privacy fears as DNA data of millions goes up for sale
top_comments:
To all the comments talking about how privacy means you never used one of these things, you're wrong. If your parents, siblings, cousins, uncles, kids, or even grandma's sister twice removed use these things they learn about you too. With enough points of  data you can basically pinpoint anybody and guess with reasonable certainty their genetic inheritance. 

Insurance companies buying up databases like this to target individuals with higher premiums for certain care (like Ashkenazi Jews and breast cancer) are the problem. We need laws to prevent any use of different or preferential treatment based on genetic markings of any kind.
I hate to break it to you but it was for sale before they went bankrupt, that’s how they made money. Evidently not enough money though
How much you want to bet someone in the health insurance business will buy this data? I'm betting they are willing to spend a lot more than anyone not in the business.

I have 3 family members use this site. When my mother did it...it already showed she had 3 kids but we were unidentified in her tree. The other two members her brother and her brothers daughter also were mapped out.

And she found out when grandpa went to war and left from Texas she has a half brother there who has a son my age 40 and used that site and found them.

My concern is if something like this is acwuired by a hostile or venture capitalist funded healthcare system or insurance agency that it would be used to increase denials and feed bad AI like the UHC AI Claim Denial of 90%+ and be used for genetic trace marking to look for, or assume, genetic predisposition for Hereditary or Genetic illnesses and use that as a basis to increase rate of denials based on knowledge a patirnt may not even be aware of.

It becomes a network of intelligence that any nation or ctiminal organization would climax over.
if only there were warnings about giving your DNA to an opensource. But hey, not knowing that you're .4 % Levantine would drive anyone insane.
They already lost data to hack. Of course they are gonna sell it too.

Insurance companies are salivating at this opportunity. Pre-existing condition? No, even better - genetically predisposed condition is where the gravy is, baby. Already-manifesting conditions is so early 2020s.
Those of us afraid for privacy have avoided these sites like the plague.  Being afraid for privacy after you've already given out all your info isn't ideal.
I'll buy it, my offer is 20 bucks. I'll look through it, nod sagely while pretending to understand, and delete it.

posts.title: After living in the US for 35 years and raising 3 citizens, these parents got deported to Colombia. Their kids want them back
top_comments:
From the article: 

“Gladys and Nelson came to the United States without authorization in 1989, according to an Immigration and Customs Enforcement statement dated March 14. They had no visas when they arrived, Crooms said, but were granted permission to apply for asylum. The couple was fleeing crime in their native Colombia, according to Crooms and their daughter Stephanie.

In 2000, the immigration court found no legal reason that would allow Gladys and Nelson to stay in the United States and they were issued a voluntary departure order, which gives people a certain amount of time to leave the country at their own expense to avoid a deportation order, according to ICE.“

They applied for asylum, denied and ordered to come back to Columbia. 

When people applied for asylum they issued temporary SS number and work permit. 
How did they legally worked in US for 30 years without valid SS number?
As shitty as it is, this isn’t a current administration caused problem. They were told 25 years ago they had to leave.

to be clear, they agreed to be deported, but stayed.

they did follow the agreement they made with the USCIS for check ins (for like 20 yrs of doing that), but they always knew this could happen.

unfortunately, their number got called.

hopefully the kids will sponsor them and they can return in 10 yrs.

i wonder how many other immigrant families had this happen to them, it’s just the media picked this aesthetic family who can speak perfectly fluent english to compound the story….living in gorgeous and expensive newport beach, no less.

just saying.
They lost their hearings and were ordered to leave and failed to do so…this one isn’t the hill to die on

*"In 2000, the immigration court found no legal reason that would allow Gladys and Nelson to stay in the United States and they were issued a voluntary departure order, which gives people a certain amount of time to leave the country at their own expense to avoid a deportation order, according to ICE*

*...*

*The Gonzalezes did not plan to leave the United States after the order was issued, according to Crooms, who said the couple’s attorney at the time misled them that the order could be appealed and possibly lead to eventual legalization.*

*...*

*The couple’s deportation officer “had not pushed for them to depart until 2018,” leveling with them that it was time to leave the country if their status couldn’t be legalized, Crooms said."*

Seems pretty reasonable to me they needed to be deported, they've been told so since 2000, and again in 2018. Just not in handcuffs.

So, they overstayed by 25 years?

>**In 2000, the immigration court found no legal reason that would allow Gladys and Nelson to stay in the United States and they were issued a voluntary departure order**, which gives people a certain amount of time to leave the country at their own expense to avoid a deportation order, according to ICE.
Damn, I would be devastated if something like that happens to my parents. I hope the best for them.

Entered illegally, informed to leave, didn't do it.

What should happen?

“Gladys and Nelson came to the United States without authorization in 1989

In 2000, the immigration court found no legal reason that would allow Gladys and Nelson to stay in the United States and they were issued a voluntary departure order, which gives people a certain amount of time to leave the country at their own expense to avoid a deportation order.”

So they entered illegally 36 years ago. Where ordered to leave 25 years ago and chose not to. I would say the US government was more then fair and consideret before deportation. They thought they were above the law. Their children can blame them not the US government.
The news would be that the government allowed them to be illegal 35 years. Not that they were finally deported.
